request_pathways.name: Request for Release of Information Form

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients must use a general-purpose 'Request for Release of Information' authorization form designed for third-party transfers, placing their own name in the 'Release To' field.

red_flags: SSN collection on records request form — unnecessary and creates identity theft risk
Ambiguous employee/witness signature line may imply in-person submission requirement
No submission instructions printed on form — patient has no guidance on where or how to return it
Form has not been updated since February 2018
bright_spots: Helpful example text for record type field: '(Example: Office Notes, Labs, In-Office Testing, all records)'
Clean dual-signature sensitive information consent design giving patients explicit opt-in/opt-out control

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — dedicated 'Request Medical Records' page under Patient Resources with direct PDF link, also linked from 'Other Patient Forms' page.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Primarily a paper workflow — flat PDF with zero fillable fields requires printing and handwriting; no electronic submission method (fax, email, or portal) is documented on the form or in retrieval notes.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but with notable problems — logical one-page layout with helpful example text, but missing submission instructions, no date range field, cramped density, and mix of plain language with legal boilerplate.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is not addressed — form is entirely framed as third-party release authorization with no right-of-access language, no 'patient self-request' purpose option, and no acknowledgment that patients have a legal right to their records.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements that may go beyond what the law requires — SSN collection is unnecessary for patient access, ambiguous witness line could constitute an extra-legal barrier; standard revocation/expiration terms and re-disclosure warning are appropriate.

overall.summary: Alabama Medical Group provides an easily findable but dated generic ROI authorization form with no patient-access differentiation, no fillable fields, no electronic submission pathway, and unnecessary SSN collection.
